sub_title: Communication & Adoption & Change from the Digital Workplace at Inter IKEA |Female entrepreneur on a crusade against singled-out-socks🧦 |Goya Award winner Best Documentary Film |Life-long learner |Challenge enthusiast
summary:
I have an award-winning career as film production manager, e-learning tutor and published writer. Storytelling, B2B communications and internal corporate communications are core skills I have developed along my more than 15 years of professional career. 
Approaching every new assignment with the passion of a freshman and the resources of a mature self-made professional is my recipe for success. 
Bringing positive approach to hostile situations from an honest, straightforward diplomatic and empathetic point of view is my trademark. 
Working under pressure without jeopardising quality nor exceeding the assigned budget had been a must in each project I had been involved on. I feel comfortable working as an inclusive leader as well as being part of a team. 
I have a hands-on approach towards being part of my new Dutch community. I actively volunteer for several local institutions, including the Just Peace Festival of the Hague, the World in your classroom program powered by The Hague City Hall. 
I am a founding member of The Hague University Toastmasters  Intl. chapter. A club that trains its members to become inspiring leaders and excellent storytellers.
My soft skills are my best assets.

projects.title: Festival rondom Internationale Vrouwendag 2015 in Delft
projects.description:
A 10 day long bilingual (Dutch and English) festival about International Women's Day celebrated in Delft. 
"Het doel van dit festival is om vrouwen en mannen bij elkaar te brengen om te netwerken, van elkaar leren, geïnspireerd te raken door rolmodellen uit het verleden en uit 2015. Het gaat erom: Wat zit in je? Wat is je bron? Hoe laat je dat zien? En bovenal elkaar de ruimte geven en respecteren: op die basis worden steeds meer vrouwen economisch zelfstandig”. 
(Sephine Laros, voorzitter  van het 8 Maart Comité Delft 2015).

projects.title: Crònica d'una campanya (Chronicles of a political campaign)
projects.description:
Production manager

"Chronicles of a political campaign" is a documentary film that gained full access to the "war room" of Convergència democràtica de Catalunya a month before 2010 elections. Through Olaskoaga's camera, the spectator gets to see and understand the strategies behind the scenes. Who are the people that work behind the candidate and making him a winner.

projects.title: Bicycle, Spoon, Apple
projects.description:
Worked as a production manager in this super production for more than 2 years. Bicycle, Spoon, Apple won Goya award for Best Documentary Film in 2011 amongst many others.
It was screened in festivals all over the world and bought by more than 60 tv channels. 

Synopsis: In October 2007, Pasqual Maragall was diagnosed with Alzheimer's. Once past the initial blow, he and his family embarked on a crusade against the disease. With intelligence, sincerity and an infectious spirit, Maragall allows a portrait to be painted of not only himself, but also his family and his doctors, in order to leave behind a lasting document of his personal fight. 
Two years of following an exceptional patient, one who is hoping scientists find a cure before the number of 26 million sufferers of this disease is multiplied by ten. A tough film, but an optimistic one all the same.
